verses.roman:
vipro gṛhītvā mṛtakaṁ
rāja-dvāry upadhāya saḥ
idaṁ provāca vilapann
āturo dīna-mānasaḥ

synonyms: vipraḥ—the brāhmaṇa; gṛhītvā—taking; mṛtakam—the corpse; rāja—of the King (Ugrasena); dvāri—at the door; upadhāya—presenting it; saḥ—he; idam—this; provāca—said; vilapan—lamenting; āturaḥ—agitated; dīna—depressed; mānasaḥ—whose mind.
translation: The brāhmaṇa took the corpse and placed it at the door of King Ugrasena's court. Then, agitated and lamenting miserably, he spoke the following.
